description: Second Brain methodology: CODE, PARA, MOCs, Progressive Summarization

questions.question: What is Progressive Summarization?
options: A 3-level method of distilling notes over time
Making notes more complex over time
questions.correct_answer: A 3-level method of distilling notes over time
questions.explanation: Progressive Summarization has 3 levels: Level 1 (bold key points), Level 2 (highlight main points), Level 3 (executive summary).

questions.question: In PARA, where should reference material go?
questions.explanation: Resources are topics of ongoing interest - perfect for reference material you might want to access later.

questions.question: Evergreen notes are notes that grow in value over time.
questions.explanation: Evergreen notes are living documents that you continuously update and refine, making them more valuable over time.

questions.question: What is the Express phase in CODE?
questions.explanation: The Express phase is about creating value from your notes - writing articles, creating presentations, building projects.

questions.question: When should you create a MOC?
options: At the start of every project
questions.explanation: MOCs help organize related notes. Create one when you have 3 or more notes on a similar topic.
